entry.title: Yard Order API method does not update field 'WEIGHT'
entry.content:
Hi All,

We created a Yard Order with products at the item level using the API /SAPYL/CL_API_YARD_ORDER.

When attempting to update the Yard Order items from the Freight Order (sending loading instructions), we encounter the following errors:

Field WEIGHT cannot be changed since it is read-only.
Field TARE_WEIGHT cannot be changed since it is read-only.
Field VOLUME cannot be changed since it is read-only.
Field LENGTH cannot be changed since it is read-only.

We are currently on release 500. The available SAP Notes I have found are relevant only for earlier releases (200 and 400):

  • 2646482 – Yard Order API method does not update field WEIGHT

  • 2991727 – Yard Request can’t be updated from external system (TM or ERP) (Release 400)

Is there a solution on release 500?

entry.title: Re: Need license key for SAP BO 4.2 to 4.3 upgrade
entry.content:
Regarding to your issue, kindly refer to KBA 2251998 - How to generate license keys for SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform (all versions) - SAP for Me

  1. In SAP for Me, open License Keys
  2. Select/Search for the installation number :20*****
  3. Click + Add New System
  4. Enter system data as follows:
    • Product: SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence platform
    • Version: SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence platform 4.3
    • System ID: Enter any 3 alphanumeric characters starting with a letter A-Z (e.g. "B43")    Tip: See KBA 2952755 for more information.
    • System name: Optional free text
    • System type: Select from drop-down (e.g. Productive, Test, Development, Backup)
    • Operating System: Select from drop-down
  5. Click Continue
  6. Click + Add License Key
    • Material: Select from drop-down list  Tip: See KBA 2947504 for more information.
    • Version: XI 4.3
    • Number of Licenses:  Enter the quantity needed  Tip: The amount available is displayed in the material choosed above. See KBA 2952762
  7. Click Add
  8. Steps 1-7 should be repeated if multiple license keys for the same product/version are desired to be generated.
  9. Select the license material(s)
  10. Click Generate

Then download the new key to install in your system which is 4.3 version.

entry.title: SAP Mobile Start V2.4: SAP Document AI integration and much more. Release Update
entry.content:
With the recently released version 2.4, SAP Mobile Start has provided a lot of new features, like integrating with SAP Document AI, onboarding via deep links and the support of additional text (sensitive content) in native push notifications. 
Let´s have a joint look at those new features. 

With the integration with SAP Document AI, users can scan or upload documents directly from SAP Mobile Start, which are then processed by the SAP Document AI service. So, if you for instance need to scan and upload a quality certificate, you can start the upload process right from SAP Mobile Start, and the SAP Document AI service takes care of all needed follow-up steps, like extracting the data and assigning it to the right business objects.  

 
Screenshots: SMS with SAP Document AI
 
For further information and a detailed step by step guide on how to setup SAP Document AI service within SAP Mobile Start, please have a look at my colleague Umair´s blog: New in SAP Mobile Start V2.4: Integrate and Launch SAP Document AI on Mobile. 
 
In my last blog, I introduced the site switch. Since our last release, SAP Mobile Start remembers your previous site connections, including multiple different sites and you can easily switch between sites by signing out and then selecting the respective site from the site menu. Now, with version 2.4, you can do this directly from the app profile and settings menu, which makes the process even simpler.
 
 Screenshot: Site switch in Profile screen. 
 
So far, SAP Mobile Start has supported two comfortable ways to onboard users. First, users can onboard by scanning a QR code from the SAP Build Work Zone or SAP Start web page. Second, users can get onboarded automatically via a managed configuration if an Mobile Device Management system is in place. Now, users can also be onboarded via deep link.
How does this work? IT teams can invite users to onboard to SAP Mobile Start via an email or message and provide a deep-link that users can use to initiate the onboarding process, after they have installed the app. After tapping on the link, SAP Mobile Start opens and the user can directly onboard to the respective SAP Build Work Zone/ SAP Start system. You can find further details in our documentation.
 
With version 2.4 we have also introduced Top News – news that is so important to users, that it is shown prominently on the Start Screen. As for the regular news, this feature can also easily be added via the SAP Build Work Zone Site Manager.Regular news are still supported as well. Please check our documentation for details. 

Screenshot: Top News
 
Until now, only public text was visible in push notifications, which often resulted in generic messages lacking sufficient context for the user. With the 2.4 release, SAP Mobile Start can now load and display additional details directly in the push notification, providing more meaningful and informative messages. This enhancement is controlled by a feature flag in the Mobile Services Admin Cockpit. For further information, please see our documentation on notifications and on how to access the cockpit. 
 
Screenshot: Additional details in push notifications
 
I hope you will enjoy these new features in SAP Mobile Start.
 
For further information on the new topics, please check our SAP Mobile Start documentation.
SAP Mobile Experience offers intelligent native mobile solutions that help businesses build more efficient, resilient and sustainable end-to-end processes, improving people’s work life wherever they are.
Visit SAP Mobile Experience Community Page and click “follow” to get the latest development and innovation of our solutions. We look forward to hearing about your experience with setting up the solution in your landscape; please do share your thoughts and comments below. Enter here for additional questions regarding SAP Mobile Experience Applications.
Want to be notified? Check your profile settings to ensure you have your settings activated.

entry.title: Difference between Replication flow vs Remote Table replication flow in Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi,

This content will help us to understand the major difference between Replication flow & Remote Table - Replication flow in one page 

What connectors require ?

Replication flow : SAP Cloud connector can be used to connect ABAP Based systems  

Remote Table Replication flow : DP Agent acts as bridge between Dataspehre and On premise system 

Supportable source objects :

Replication flow : Allows the replication of multiple Assests (CDS Views as source) with in single flow. 

Remote Table Replication flow : Individual data asset( CDS View / Table)  

 Data Target : 

Replication flow : Data can load into  both SAP Datasphere and External source systems as target systems 

Remote Replication flow : Target is only SAP Datasphere 

 Data Loads :

 

Replication Flow we have two Options : 

Initial Only : Loads all the data once from the source  

Initial And Delta : After the Initial load System checks for source data changes at regular intervals and transfer delta to the target system  

We can customize the interval you can customize this interval via the side panel, setting it to any value between 0-24 hours and 0-59 minutes 

 

Remote Table Replication : We have two Modes  

Snapshot replication: This method copies the full dataset from a source object (e.g., a database table of view) into SAP Datasphere in one go (ie. a static full load per run) Ex month end balances , Head counts 

Real-Time Data Replication via “Enable Real-Time Data Replication” option Here, data changes from the source object are continuously replicated into SAP Datasphere, until the run is terminated manually/per schedule. replication frequency is system-defined and cannot be manually adjusted in SAP Datasphere  

What is Partitioning and Parallelization 

Partitioning and parallelizing the data transfers improves performance when replicating large datasets. 

The approach varies depending on the source object type 

ABAP source system, SLT-table, and CDS-view based data replication: Partitions are calculated automatically, but users can manually adjust them via SAP ABAP system parameters 

ABAP source system, ODP based data replication: By default, the number of partitions is 3. But users can modify this via the ODP_RMS_PARTITIONS_LOAD parameter in SAP ABAP system. 

Database source system, table-based replication: Partitions are automatically determined and cannot be modified. 

Parllel processing :  

A replication flow can contain a maximum of 500 replication objects. 

By default, a replication flow can utilize up to two replication flow jobs 

A replication flow job can process up to five work orders for data transfer and five work orders for housekeeping. (Work orders are internal objects that are needed to organize the work efficiently.)  

If a replication object is divided into partitions, each partition is processed by one work order. 

Each data transfer work order requires a thread, that is, a technical connection to both the source and target 

Each replication flow counts towards the total possible maximum of 10 parallel jobs in one tenant. 

if you have 10 replication flow jobs, you can process a total possible maximum of 50 work orders for data transfer and 50 work orders for housekeeping. With one thread per work order, the total maximum for threads is 100 for the source and for the target, respectively. (You can still have more than 10 replication flows, but not more than 10 replication flows can run in parallel at any given point in time.) 

Sizing for Delta Loading 

For delta loading, the default is that each object is processed as one partition by one data transfer work order, resulting in a total of 5 data transfer work orders and one replication flow job being utilized 

The main intention of this blog is to clarify in which scenario we opt replication flow and  Remote table replication flow. Utilization of them is different though they are identical in nature.

You can Add your thoughts or knowledge which i missed to list here 

Best Regards,

Kartheek Kota

entry.title: cTMS Setup for Transporting BTP Role Collections
entry.content:
Introduction

Most Role Collections related to custom application development are handled by the respective application's transport mechanism.

However, in scenarios where, Role Collections are not tied to custom applications but are needed for team-based access control or setup for some other purpose. 

You can now transport role collections using the Content Agent service UI integrated with Cloud Transport Management Service. 

Limitations:
This solution is not fully matured. Specifically, the transport mechanism currently fails to ignore application identifiers associated with roles. As a result, you may encounter errors when trying to move a role collection along with its roles.

Due to this issue, we were unable to use this method reliably. SAP has acknowledged the limitation and indicated that a fix is on their roadmap, but as of now, there are no specific timelines for resolution.

Let us deep dive into the procedure of setting cTMS for BTP Role Collections. 

cTMS Architecture – BTP Role Collections Transports

Here we have four environments, Dev, QA, UAT, and Prod, each corresponding to a separate BTP subaccount. We have provisioned the Cloud Transport Management Service (cTMS) in a separate subaccount. The Security team sets up their Role Collections and export the same from the Dev subaccount using Content Agent Service integrated with Cloud Transport Management Service (cTMS), which then adds the transport to the QA node. From there, it is imported into QA and the subsequent environments (UAT, Prod) through Solution Manager (SolMan), leveraging Focused Build (FB) or Charm status transitions.

Additionally, this setup can be integrated with SAP Cloud ALM

Setup Steps:

Since several of these SaaS applications share common setup steps, please begin by following the initial setup steps outlined here Setting Up Cloud TMS for Various SAP SaaS Solutions 

Step1: Create Service Instance/Key for SAP Authorization and Trust Management Service

SAP changed the way we setup Service Instance/Key for SAP Authorization and Trust Management, it is no longer setup using BTP cockpit, we have to setup by following below steps using BTP CLI

  1. Log on to the SAP BTP CLI, targeting the relevant global account, directory, or subaccount.
  2. Enter the following command: from the location where you kept this btp.exe

    .\btp.exe create security/api-credential --name my-credential

    You get API credentials, which enable you to access the REST APIs of the SAP Authorization and Trust Management service

    The btp CLI shows the API credential as follows:

     Output Code
    Name: my-credential
Credential Type: binding-secret
Read-only: false
Client Secret: <secret>
Certificate: <null>
Client ID: sb-full-access!axxxx

Step2: Create SAP Authorizations and Trust Management Service Destination

In all BTP subaccounts where you perform export/import operations, create a destination for SAP Authorization and Trust Management service. This is mandatory, without which you will not be able to export/import content successfully. 

Name: Name should be "XSUAARoleCollections"

URL: https://api.authentication.<region>.hana.ondemand.com.

Authentication: OAuth2ClientCredentials

Token Service URL: https://<subdomain>.authentication.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token

Grab Client ID & Secret from Service Key setup for SAP Authorizations and Trust Management Service in step1. 

Step3: Create TransportManagementService Destination

SAP Content Agent service supports content transport using SAP Cloud Transport Management. To enable this service to Export the content to the transport queue of cTMS, the destination must be created in the Source SAP BTP account with this name. 

Name: Name should be "TransportManagementService"

URL: uri from the cTMS service key

Authentication: OAuth2ClientCredentials

Token Service URL: uaa → url from the cTMS service key 

Grab Client ID & Secret from cTMS Service Key. 

Step4: Create a Service Instance and Key for Content Agent Service

In the Target SAP BTP account, where you want to perform Import, you create the service instance and service key for the SAP Content Agent service with application plan. 

This service key will be used in creating Destinations. 

Step5: Create Destinations to CF Subaccounts

In the subaccount where the Cloud Transport Management (cTMS) service is subscribed, create a destination to each target BTP subaccount. We don't setup any destination for Dev subaccount. Dev node in cTMS will be virtual for this scenario. 

Name: Give appropriate name to resemble your CTMS Node

URL:https://content-agent-engine.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com

Authentication: OAuth2ClientCredentials

Token Service URL: https://<subdomain>.authentication.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token

Please use the client ID, client id, secret, from the Content Agent service key created in step4 above. 

Step6: Configure Transport Nodes in cTMS

Prerequisites

  • You have been assigned one of the following roles: Administrator or LandscapeOperator.

From the cTMS UI, you can define transport nodes to represent your system landscape. There are multiple ways to create a node:

You can either Create a node on the Landscape Visualization screen or from Transport Nodes screen. 

Allow Upload to Node: Enable this checkbox to allow file uploads to the node. Enabled for the Dev node but in this scenario, Dev node will virtual. 

Forward Mode: Default value is Auto, You can change this setting based on your landscape and transport flow requirements.

Controlled by SAP Solution Manager: Select this checkbox only if you plan to integrate with SAP Solution Manager (e.g., Charm or Focused Build). We will only enable this for QA and upper environments.  When you enable this, it will not allow manual imports from cTMS UI, only through Charm/FB status change. 

Note: If you plan to integrate with Cloud ALM, do not check this option. 

Content Type: For Content Agent Service, select Multitarget Application archives.

Destination: Select the appropriate target destination you previously configured in your cTMS subaccount in Step5.

Step7: Create Transport routes in cTMS

In SAP Cloud Transport Management, transport routes are used to connect transport nodes.

Name: Provide the appropriate name

Chose the Source node & Target node and click on OK. 

Your landscape loos like this

Note: You can also use Transport Landscape Wizard, with which you can setup the all your landscape nodes & routes at a time.

Step8: Subscribe to Content Agent Service in Dev Subaccount

To export the Role Collection content using Content Agent Service, we have to subscribe to CAS in Dev subaccount. Please follow these steps for the same:

  1. Navigate to your SAP BTP Dev subaccount, where you want to subscribe to the Content Agent Service.

  2. From the left-hand navigation pane, go to: Services → Service Marketplace

  3. In the Service Marketplace, search for Content Agent.

  4. Select the Content Agent tile from the search results.

  5. Click Create 

  6. From the Plan dropdown, select free (the service type is preselected as Content Agent).

  7. Click Create to confirm the subscription.

  8. Click on Go Application to access Content Agent Service UI

From there you will be able to select the Content and export as transport using cTMS. 

Step9: Integrate with Solution Manager

To integrate Cloud Transport Management (cTMS) with SAP Solution Manager (Charm / Focused Build), follow the step6 from below article. 

If you want to integrate with Cloud ALM, follow the step7 from below article. 

 Setting Up Cloud TMS for Various SAP SaaS Solutions 

Conclusion:

I hope you learned, how to setup cTMS for BTP Role Collection transports using Content Agent Service. Now the setup is complete and ready for transport the content using cTMS either integrated with SAP Solution Manager or Cloud ALM.

Thank you for reading  my article, feel free to provide any feedback or comment for any questions.

Thanks,
Raghu

entry.title: Re: new installation number 9102xxxx, isn't listed under...
entry.content:
In order for S-users to create cases for SFSF Installation, S-users must be given the 'Display Cloud Data' authorization on the SuccessFactors installation number level, along with standard case authorizations. After conducting research, I can verify that the issue is occurring because your S-user does not currently have the 'Display Cloud Data' authorization for installation 9102xxxx . This lack of authorization is preventing you from creating cases for this installation 9102xxxx.

To resolve this, you will need to contact a Cloud Administrator for installation 9102xxxx. You can find the relevant Cloud Administrator listed under the Users & Contacts - SAP for Me section in SAP for Me. They will need to grant the 'Display Cloud Data' authorization to your S-user.

Below are some useful KBAs that will help you understand this topic.

2598170 - What is the Display Cloud Data authorization? - SAP for Me 

2193754 - S-user is unable to create or view SuccessFactors support cases - SAP for Me 

2607729 - Tips on creating a SuccessFactors support case - SAP for Me

entry.title: How to handle Stock Specific UOM at Product level
entry.content:
Business Problem: Customer has different product in the warehouse in which some products should be updated in Alternative UoM(AUoM)  and some products should be updated in Base Unit of measure BUoM during stock placement against IBD or receiving against Manufacturing Order( Production Or Process Order).

Strictly for some products, customer requirement is to prevent AUoM data being transferred into the stock attributes( Highlighted in Yellow), however for some it should have mix in the same Storage Type( Product ending with 568)

Stock Specific UOM at UOM/Whse Level.

  • The SUoM relevance is maintained on UoM level in SPRO. The product does not have any influence in the customizing activity. Nevertheless, there might be products that share the same alternative UoM (e.g. CAR for carton). But, some of them should follow SUoM processes and others not.

Solution:  To handle these kinds of Mix stock scenario in same storage type level, SAP has given 2 solution based on Business needs and complexity

  • Usage of Product Putaway Profile- Customizing entry
  • Badi /SCWM/EX_MD_FLG_SUOM_DET

The blog will discuss how to handle Product Specific SUoM for the same storage type using product Putaway Profile.

Take a product having BUoM  to AUoM conversion.

 CV and PAL both are activated as SUoM at whse level.

Activate the required storage type config to store stock based on product Putaway Profile( Either BUoM or AUoM).

The first product in the above example needs to be stored in BUoM only and hence below setting is activated at product putaway profile level to store stock at BUoM only and prevent AUoM data being transferred into the stock attributes( in Whse Monitor)

Assign the PTWY control indicator which controls Product Putaway profile config as well in MAT1

Performing the receiving activity( REHU MO)

After during Warehouse Task confirmation, TASK was created in PAL( AUoM) as explained in NOTE 2745415 - AUoM during Warehouse Task creation.

However, after task confirmation, Both QTY is BUoM only

Actual Stock situation before and after activation of Product Pty Profile

Customer can implement /SCWM/EX_MD_FLG_SUOM_DET BAdI to define at the product level, whether or not particular UoMs are stock-specific for particular products.

Please implement all the notes based on your version for correct behavior.

All test is performed in S/4 HANA 2023 FPS02 system.

entry.title: Real-Time Integration with SAP IBP in SAP EarlyWatch Alert
entry.content:
The SAP EarlyWatch Alert now covers several topics relevant for your SAP Integrated Business Planning and connected SAP S/4HANA or SAP ECC system when using Real-Time Integration (RTI). The SAP EarlyWatch Alert is an automated service that analyzes the essential administrative areas of customer systems, alerts on critical situations and offers recommendations/solutions to improve performance and stability.

You can find relevant content for when you are just getting started with RTI, as well as when you are already running it.

📝 find the implementation project evaluation questionnaire

🔍 identify attributes with modified field length that can lead to integration issues

⚠️ get insights into missing pre-requisites in your connected SAP S/4HANA or SAP ECC system

 

Are you just starting to configure RTI for SAP IBP? 

Find the implementation project evaluation questionnaire via the SAP EarlyWatch Alert!

The SAP EarlyWatch Alerts when you are starting to configure RTI in your SAP IBP system and links you to the implementation project evaluation questionnaire provided in SAP Note 3558655 to help you to support your SAP IBP Real Time Integration project. It offers an independent first review of your project's risks, helping you achieve a successful outcome.

You can find the chapter by searching for "real time integration implementation" in the Solution  Finder https://me.sap.com/ewa/solutionfinder/generic/filters/search=Real%20Time%20Integration%20Implementation 

 

Identify attributes with a modified field length that could lead to integration issues!

A deviation from the standard attribute field length can lead to functional issues during the integration when using Real-Time Integration. The SAP EarlyWatch Alert gives you an overview over any attributes in use in your system that have a modified field length.

You can find the chapter by searching for "attribute field length" in the Solution  Finder https://me.sap.com/ewa/solutionfinder/generic/filters/search=attribute%20field%20length 

 

Get insights into pre-requisites for RTI in your connected SAP S/4HANA or SAP ECC system!

To ensure a smooth integration to your SAP IBP system, there is a number of SAP Notes published with every new SAP IBP release for the connected SAP S/4HANA or SAP ECC system. These SAP Notes should be implemented in the system. Additionally, relevant business functions should be activated.

You can find the chapter by searching for "missing rti" in the Solution  Finder https://me.sap.com/ewa/solutionfinder/generic/filters/search=missing%20rti

 

Stay tuned for more content regarding Real-Time Integration with SAP IBP to be added to the SAP EarlyWatch Alert! 🚀

entry.title: Blog It Forward – Marla Alschweiki
entry.content:
I’m happy to join the Blog It Forward – The Sequel challenge and share a bit about myself and my SAP journey.

About Me

I started my SAP career over 8 years ago as a software developer and later specialized in SAP Data Analytics, AI, and intelligent applications. Today, I work as a Senior Data & AI Development Consultant at PwC, focusing on SAP AI Core, SAP BDC, SAP S/4HANA Data Analytics, RAP, and Fiori/UI5 development.

I’m passionate about contributing to the SAP Community, sharing knowledge, and taking part in events like SAP TechEd. When I’m not working, I’m usually with my puppy Carlo, exploring the nature around us, or joining Carlo in a new adventure outdoors.🐶😁

 

Answering Some Blog It Forward Questions

If I were 20 again, what would I study?
I’d still choose technology all over again, but I would add more AI and data science earlier in my studies.

Describe in one short sentence: “What need does your SAP solution meet”?
I design solutions that turn data into actionable insights, making processes smarter and decisions faster.

What’s the best lesson you’ve learned?
To work hard, stay true to myself, and keep learning every day.

Share a fun fact or story about yourself

My puppy, Carlo, is my best productivity coach. Daily walks reset my brain after long debugging sessions. He also inspired a small RAP and Fiori demo app I built around a “dogs” table to teach CRUD, annotations, and analytics basics.

Do you know any other cool or very unique solutions related to your topic?

Yes. i'm a huge fan of Hugging Face Transformers on SAP BTP  and based on my experience it works well for NLP use cases like classification, extraction, and summarization.

What do you most enjoy about the SAP Community?

i Love the energy in the community , Real problems, fast feedback, and generous knowledge sharing. Blogs, code samples, and forum threads shorten the path from idea to working solution. Events like TechEd keep me current and connected.

Five Things I Want to Achieve

  • See the Northern Lights  🌌
  • Help rescued pets find homes 🐶
  • Publish a book about AI and SAP 📘
  • pay it forward and mentor young tech professionals 👩‍💻
  • Live by the sea 🌊

Blogging It Forward

I’d like to blog it forward to:

  • @TammyPowlas  for  her extensive mentorship and community leadership.

  • @Vitaliy-Rfor her inspiring work in SAP development

My questions for you:

  1. What’s one SAP skill you wish you had learned earlier?

  2. If you could combine any SAP technology with AI, what would you build?

#BIF #Blogitforward

entry.title: Re: HI guys
entry.content:
It looks like the issue is happening in transaction KP26 (used for planning activity prices in SAP Controlling).

 

From what you described, two things are happening:

The fixed costs are not being displayed.

When you try to enter a value in the “Fixed Price” field, you get an integration check error in the log.

Possible causes:

-Wrong planning version or fiscal year – You might be in the wrong version or year for planning

-Missing activity type setup – The activity type might not be linked to a valid cost center

-Missing master data – Fixed costs won’t appear if they haven’t been entered in KP06 or if the cost assignment key is incomplete

-Integration control issues – There may be a block in the FI-CO integration (for example, if the cost center isn’t assigned to the controlling area)

How to fix it:

Make sure the Controlling Area is correctly assigned and active for the fiscal year.

In KP26, check that the activity type is assigned to a valid cost center in KS01/KS02.

Enter the fixed costs in KP06 before trying to maintain the activity price.

Check the integration settings in OKKP (controlling area configuration).

Look at the full error log to see if there’s a specific SAP error code (like KIxxx or Kxxx) — that will narrow down the root cause.

entry.title: Re: BAPI or FM to update the tables GEOCDER and GEOT05

The mentioned tables seems to be incorrect. To my knowledge, there is a table GEOCODERS and not sure what the other one you mentioned. Nevertheless, updating SAP tables GEOCDER and GEOT05 (or for any table) directly via BAPI or Function Module is not straightforward, as these are technical geolocation tables typically managed internally by SAP Yard Logistics or SAP TM components.

Though the Function Module GEO_UPDATE_GEOLOC is available to update geolocation data, it requires the GEOOBJR key, which is not easily retrievable via standard APIs. So, please share what the Business requirement is and why you want to update those tables?

entry.title: PERFORMING THE MAINTENANCE BY EXTERNAL TEAM (BY USING OF CONTROL KEY)
entry.content:
Performing The Maintenance By External Team: - 

Let's say the breakdown happened in the plant and the machine needs repair as soon as possible. But the person or team is not present in the plant or not aware of doing maintenance so the external vendor team need to perform the maintenance by coming into the plant.

So here the control key will play a crucial role in procuring the team or people from outside. The following are the control keys that we will be using in the operations tab: -

PM01 ---> Internal Operations (it means the team is present internally and the persons can do the maintenance of machine, and no                        procuring is required here).

PM02 ---> External Operation (Operations are performed by external vendor and here the team will come and perform the                                        maintenance of machine and procuring here is required).

PM03 ---> External Operations with service entry sheet (Operations are performed by external team in which we will procure them                         via contract basis and after performing the maintenance the settlement is being done via service entry sheet).

let us a say there is a required emergency maintenance needs to be done and here the notification is not being raised, and the order is raised directly through the transaction code IW31.

STEP 1: -

Here the order type is PM02 since it needs to be procured from outside.

Here the breakdown is checked since it is a breakdown maintenance order and, in the operations tab, we will provide the keys PM02 or PM03 based on our requirement.

STEP 2: -
In Operations tab we will provide the control keys that are required.



Here in the above example the control key is PM03 and PM02 and in which the control key

PM03 ---> It is being used for reviewing or inspection of equipment and here we will perform the service entry sheet.

PM02 ---> It is being used for maintaining of equipment and cleaning of floor as well as pump.

After maintaining the control keys, we will just get a popup in which the details of vendor and cost element need to be specified as shown in below.

The above are the minimum details that we need to give for the control key PM02 to procure the team from outside.

Here the above details are provided for the external operations service entry sheet.
And here the g/l account needs to be given by selecting the operation and clicking on external field which present on the above of the operations tab.

And after clicking on the external field button, you will be able to navigate to the next in which you need to provide the g/l account as well as the service number which will be configured by the material management team in the service master record by using the t-code AC01.

Here we will provide the service entry sheet number and then after we will just provide the g/l account for which after doing the service entry sheet.
Now just save the order and release the order, the purchase requestion will be raised in the order.

STEP3: -
Go to the change mode of the order and here just select the operation and then after click on the act.data which is present above the operations tab.

You will be navigated to another screen in which you can find the purchase requestions for the operation which needs service.

Same as do for the next operation too in which you can able to get the details of purchase requestion with the service no.

Now just forward the purchase requestion to the material management team and they will convert the p2p cycle.

STEP4: -
Here we will perform the GOODS ISSUE AGAINST ORDER IN MIGO. Here the materials needs to be present at the machine before procuring or calling the external team. If any material is not present in the invenotory then it will be procured by the MM team.

STEP5: -

Now just navigate to the t-code ME21N in which we will convert the purchase requestion into purchase order.

PM02 --> Control key

Here the price will be maintained and then after the check and post will be done.

STEP6:-

After saving the po we will perform Goods receipt in T-code MIGO - GOODS RECIEPT AGAINST PURCHASE ORDER. Here we will perform the goods receipt as they have performed the maintenance on machine and they needs to be payed so for that reason we will perform the goods receipt.

Here we will perform the check and post in the MIGO then after invoice will be done in the t-code MIRO

STEP7: -
Navigate to the t-code MIRO where we will give invoice to the vendor. After doing the invoice the FICO team will do the settlement to the vendor.

Here we will perform MIRO by giving the invoice date, business place, amount, po number and all the necessary details and then after we will just perform or click on the stimulate which is present in the application toolbar.

we will just click on the post. After performing MIRO if we want to see the invoice document number we will just navigate to the t-code MIR5.

Here we will just enter the document number and to see the details we will just execute it.

STEP8:-

Here we can see the total details of accounts and the amounts too.
Control Key --> PM03

For control key we will just follow the t-code ME21N and just enter the purchase requestion and then after we will just follow up with the next screen in which the price will be maintained.

Here you can see that the layout will be changed for this type of purchase requestion.

STEP9: -

Here we will just check and save it and the po number will be noted.
Now we will just navigate to the t-code ML81N for service entry sheet.

Here we will just click on the other purchase order which is present in the application toolbar and then after we will just click on the create after clicking on create in the application toolbar, we will adopt the services by clicking on the service selection.

Just select the service and then after we will just adopt the service.

after adopting the service, we will just get the details of the service below and now we will just click on accept.

Then the status will be changed as below: -

STEP10: -
so here we will just save the service entry sheet and then we will perform MIRO which is an invoice.

Here the invoice will be done for the purchase order. And then after we will just make it stimulate.

STEP11: -
Now the confirmation of order will be takes place since we have maintained the PM01 for some of the operations so just navigate to the t-code IW41.

After performing confirmation, we will just perform TECO - technical confirmation by navigating to the t-code IW32.

STEP12: -
After performing teco the settlement will be done by the FICO team in KO88.


Accounting document: -

Controlling documents: -

Summary: - 

In breakdown maintenance performed by an external vendor, a maintenance order is created in IW31 with control key PM02 (external without SES) or PM03 (external with SES). Vendor, G/L account, and service number are entered, and upon release, a purchase requisition is generated. This is converted to a purchase order in ME21N, followed by a goods receipt in MIGO. For PM03, a service entry sheet is created in ML81N before payment. The vendor invoice is posted in MIRO, the order is confirmed in IW41 if required, completed in IW32, and settled in KO88.


Feel free to comment or give suggestion.
Regards ,
Neeraj.

entry.title: SAP ABAP Classical Workflow: A complete guide (Part- 1)
entry.content:
Introduction:

In SAP ABAP,  classical workflow refers to the traditional workflow engine and framework that was used for automating business processes before the introduction of newer workflow technologies. 

While it is still supported, SAP has moved toward newer technologies like SAP Business Workflow and eventually SAP Build Process Automation for modern workflow requirements. However, many existing implementations still use classical workflow due to its maturity and integration with core SAP processes.

What will you learn from this post?

Creation of workflow builder, business object event, task creation, steps type- #Activity, #block, #controlprocess, #userdecision, #loop( until ), #multiplecondition,  #containeroperation, #containerelement & #tablecreation, binding process.

Additional tips: Creation & Finding BADI exit for standard transaction, i.e. ME21n.

Requirement:

If the user creates or changes the purchase order in ME21/22N transaction, the workflow will trigger to the respective approvers based on the NETPR (amount).

  • Condition one- NETPR < 200.00 Rs, it will go to LEVEL1 approvers (Multiple).
  • Condition two- NETPR > 200.00 Rs, it will go to LEVEL2 approvers(Multiple).

Technical Requirements: 

Create a BADI implementation for the standard transaction -> Create & Call the business object & event in BADI -> Maintain the Approvers list in z-table with level vice -> Create workflow builder and call the BO & event.

NOTE:  If you are already aware of how to link BO to workflow builder, then you can skip this and jump to the Part 2 post.

 

Step 1: Find and create a #BADI implementation to trigger the workflow event

Get the package name of the transaction, and pass it to the transaction SE84. 

Other way:

Use the SAP class ‘CL_EXITHANDLER’ and in this class have the method name GET_INSTANCE.

Set the Breakpoint at the Beginning of the call method.

In changing the parameter exit_name, we can identify the BADI name that is used in the standard transaction.

Finally, we found the BADI name ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST, go to transaction SE19 and create the new implementation for this BADI.

  • My implementation: ZIM_PO_WF_TRIG
  • Interface: IF_EX_ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST
  • Implementing class: ZCL_IM_IM_PO_WF_TRIG

As per the requirement, the workflow will trigger when the purchase order is saved by the end-user. So, I developed the method 'POST' with custom logic.

 METHOD if_ex_me_process_po_cust~post.

    IF sy-uname     = gc_username                                                                                               "User Name
     AND sy-mandt   = gc_client                                                                                                 "Client
     AND ( sy-tcode = gc_me21n  OR sy-tcode = gc_me22n ).                                                                       "Transaction Codes

      DATA: lt_container TYPE TABLE OF swr_cont,
            lv_return    TYPE syst-subrc,
            lv_eventid   TYPE swr_struct-event_id,
            lv_obj_type  TYPE swo_objtyp,
            lv_obj_key   TYPE swo_typeid,
            lv_netpr     TYPE string,
            lv_qty       TYPE string.


      DATA(ls_header) = im_header->get_data( ).                                                                                 "get Header Data from buffer
      DATA(lt_items) = im_header->get_items( ).

      LOOP AT lt_items INTO DATA(lo_item).
        DATA(ls_item_obj) = lo_item-item.
      ENDLOOP.
      DATA(ls_item) = ls_item_obj->get_data( ).                                                                                 "get item data from buffer

      IF gs_old_values IS NOT INITIAL AND gs_old_values-ebeln = ls_item-ebeln.
        DATA(lv_old_price) = gs_old_values-netpr.                                                                               "get old price from process_item method
      ENDIF.

      lv_netpr =  |{ ls_item-netpr CURRENCY = ls_header-waers }|.
      CONDENSE lv_netpr NO-GAPS.
      lv_qty = ls_item-menge.
      CONDENSE lv_qty NO-GAPS.

      lt_container = VALUE #( BASE lt_container
                            ( element = purchasedocument value =  ls_item-ebeln )                                                     "PURCH_DOC'
                            ( element = item             value =  ls_item-ebelp )                                                     "ITEM'
                            ( element = material         value =  ls_item-matnr )                                                     "MATERIAL'
                            ( element = plant            value =  ls_item-werks )                                                     "PLANT'
                            ( element = vendor           value =  ls_header-lifnr )                                                   "VENDOR'
                            ( element = quantity         value =  lv_qty )                                                            "QTY'
                            ( element = unit             value =  ls_item-meins )                                                     "UNIT'
                            ( element = oldamount        value =  lv_old_price )                                                      "OLDAMOUNT'
                            ( element = newamount        value =  lv_netpr  )                                                         "AMOUNT'
                            ( element = currency         value =  ls_header-waers )                                                   "CURRENCY'
                            ( element = level            value =  COND #( WHEN lv_netpr < 200 THEN gc_lev1 ELSE gc_lev2 )  ) ).       "LEVEL'

      lv_obj_key =    ls_item-ebeln.

      CALL FUNCTION 'SAP_WAPI_CREATE_EVENT'
        EXPORTING
          object_type     = gc_bo            " Business Object Repository object type
          object_key      = lv_obj_key       " Business Object Repository object key
          event           = gc_event         " Event
          commit_work     = abap_true        " Do not trigger "Commit Work" at end
          event_language  = sy-langu         " Event language
          language        = sy-langu         " SAP System, Current Language
          user            = sy-uname         " R/3 system (logon name of user)
        IMPORTING
          return_code     = lv_return        " Return code (0 - 3, 999)
          event_id        = lv_eventid       " Event ID
        TABLES
          input_container = lt_container.     " Input container (name-value pairs)

    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

Above, the CALL FUNCTION 'SAP_WAPI_CREATE_EVENT ' is called in the method, as I already created the Business object for the workflow event.

The internal table 'lt_container' is passed to the workflow through the business object event. The 'element' holds the technical field name, and 'value' holds the field's value.

Below are the constant attributes maintained in the attribute section of the implementation class:

Step 2: Create the Business object and event in transaction SWO1.

Here, I used * Cross-application, which enables workflows to span multiple modules, orchestrating complex business processes that involve different departments or systems.

Step 2.1. Create Event and required parameters that are imported from BADI exit (lt_container):

Create all required parameters that have to be passed to the workflow builder. Below are the parameters that are used in the TRIGGER event.

Step 2.2: Create BO Method and parameters that are imported and exported to the workflow builder.

This method, GET_USER, will be used to fetch the approvers list based on the level1 or level2.

For multiple value parameters, we have to select 'Multiline' options as well as select import or export or both. Above. 'USERNAME' parameter will hold the multiple approvers list, acting as a table. Below are the parameters that are used in the GET_USER method.

Click the 'Program' option as marked in the above snapshot, and it will direct you to the BO editor to implement the method with custom logic.

begin_method get_user changing container.

DATA: lv_level     TYPE char10,
      lv_purch_doc TYPE ebeln,
      username     TYPE TABLE OF wfsyst-agent,
      uscount      TYPE int1,
      lv_exit      TYPE int1.


swc_get_element container 'LEVEL'     lv_level.                                          "get values from workflow
swc_get_element container 'PURCH_DOC' lv_purch_doc.
swc_get_element container 'EXITCOND'  lv_exit.


SELECT uscount, zuname                                                                   "Approvers Maintainence Table
  FROM zpo_wf_apprvs
  INTO TABLE (lt_ustab)
  WHERE zlevel = _level.
IF sy-subrc = 0.
  uscount = lines( lt_ustab ).
ENDIF.

IF lv_level = 'LEVEL2'.
  username = VALUE #( FOR ls_ustab IN lt_ustab WHERE ( uscount = lv_exit )               "For level 2 LOOP UNTILL Process
                    ( ls_ustab-zuname ) ).
ELSE.
  username = VALUE #( FOR ls_ustab IN lt_ustab                                           "For Level 1 Block Step process
                  ( ls_ustab-zuname ) ).
ENDIF.

swc_set_element container 'USCOUNT'  uscount.                                             "set values pass to workflow
swc_set_table   container 'USERNAME' username.                                            "Multiline values (Table)

end_method.
  • swc_get_element container 'LEVEL'  lv_level - used to import the values from the workflow builder.
  • swc_set_element container 'USCOUNT'  uscount- used to export the values to the workflow builder.
  • swc_set_table   container 'USERNAME' username - used to export the multiline (table) values to the workflow builder.
  • Ztable ZPO_WF_APPRVS ZPO_WF_APPRVS contains the list of approvers' usernames.

  • The prefix 'US' is added to the username so that the workflow can recognise it as a username and will send the user decision to their inbox.

Step 2.3: Create BO Attributes & Key fields

I didn't use any attributes and used EBELN as the key field.

 Implement and release the object components & object type in the business object.

The tick mark represents the object type, and components are released. The BADI implementation and business object are developed; now we have to create the workflow builder.

We have implemented two steps: where the workflow should trigger, and the business object event that is used to call the respective workflow builder.

Step 3:

Before creating the workflow builder, we should know about the step types-  #Activity, #Sendemail, #block, #controlprocess, #userdecision, #loop( until ), #multiplecondition,  #containeroperation, #containerelement, and binding process.

  • Activity Step- It is used to execute a single task, such as a dialogue task for user interaction or a background task for automated processing.
  • Send Email- This step is used to send an email or as a notification to the respective users.
  • Block- This step is used to group multiple steps together so they can be executed in sequence or parallel, while applying a common condition or loops to the group.
  • Control Process-  If this function is executed, workflow work items are set to the status completed. If the step process control is located in a workflow that is used as a subworkflow, the calling workflow is continued.
  • User Decision- The step is used to send the user interaction task to the user's inbox, SBWP, i.e. approve or reject.
  • loop(until)- This step repeatedly executes the enclosed steps until a specified end condition is met.
  • Multiple Condition- Multiple condition step routes the workflow execution to different branches based on multiple defined conditions.
  • Container operation- This step is used to assign or change the values of workflow container elements.
  • Element Container- It is a data holder within the workflow or task container that stores specific values as a variable or as a multiline table.
  • Binding process- It is the process of mapping data between two containers, i.e., workflow container and task container, so that required values are passed correctly during execution.

Above is the developed workflow builder as per our requirement. Let's see how to create the workflow builder, binding process, and debugging techniques in the Part 2 blog.

Thanks for your time!

entry.title: Re: table PLPO can only show one operation
entry.content:
Hi @HawleyHazel 

Thank you for your question.

Just to clarify, table PLPO should list all operations for a given group and group counter in your routings or task lists. If you only see a single operation, I suggest you check:

First, that your SAP selection criteria include the group PLNNR and group counter PLNAL and ensure to leave the operation number blank.

Then, ensure you are not using a SELECT SINGLE or similar restrictive read.

Finally, make sure that the routing in CA03/CA02 actually contains multiple operations for your selected group or counter.

If after checking with SE16 or SE16N you still only see one operation in PLPO when you expect several, then that suggests that there could be a data or saving issue.

I hope this provides more clarity. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Stock – Multiple Materials key features - S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Display Warehouse Stock (MB52) is now replaced by Stock – Multiple Materials (F1595), an app that provides the same visibility — but in a more interactive and responsive way. It supports personalization, grouping, exporting, and even better performance with large data volumes. Users can view stock by material, location, special stock, and unit of measure — all with real-time integration.

  • Advanced Search Capabilities: several filter options for searching large amounts of data specifically for the required materials;
  • Display a stock overview of one or multiple materials;
  • Display the current value of the stock (using the current material price) or the value of the stock (based on the historical value);
    • Sometimes we work with materials that have variable prices, such as commodities. In these cases, the current price might not reflect the most relevant valuation. Instead, what’s often more useful is to analyze the historical valuation of the material over time.
  • Display additional storage location information, for example, storage bin (like a shelf, pallet location).
  • Display the carbon footprint of the materials in the plant (with the activation of SAP Sustainability Footprint Management Integration into Core Processes);
  • Display the stock with different reporting dates; 
    • Possible to filter by a past date and visualize the stock.
  • Export the result list to a spreadsheet.
  • Send a link to the material document details by e-mail;
  • Share the material document using chat in Microsoft Teams;
  • Schedule Export of Inventory Analytics -
    • With this app, it's possible to schedule a background job to export material stock from the Stock – Multiple Materials and posting data for a defined period. This is very useful for inventory control, and it allows to generate the report independently, which makes things much easier. 
    • It's possible to schedule a job in a period of time too.

  • If you access the option inside the Stock – Multiple Materials, you have a very limited vision, so it's recommended to access the app Schedule Export of Inventory Analytics.

entry.title: Managing Legacy Files for India GSTR reports in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
entry.content:
Introduction 

When implementing SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for GST reporting in India, it may be necessary to store legacy GST-filed documents and responses (for example, GSTR1 filling json, GSTR3B etc.) from the GSTN for future reference and audit purposes. This blog presents a practical approach to manually storing and managing previously reported files within SAP Document and Reporting Compliance by using Attachment section in the Generated Run. 

Disclaimer: This document does not replace a legally required or system-generated statutory file. 

Part 1: Technical Prerequisites 

Step 1: Create a Custom Report Definition 

Begin by setting up a custom report definition to manage historical files. This involves: 

  • Custom Report Definition: Tailor a report specifically for historical data. 
  • Corresponding Report Category: Categorize the report appropriately. 
  • Custom Entity: Create if necessary. 

 for example, ZIN_GSTR1 or YIN_GSTR1 etc. 

Note: Either you can use the same Z or Y report created above, across multiple GST reports or you can create a new report based on the functionality. 

Refer to SAP Documentation for detailed instructions on defining statutory reports SAP Documentation – Define Statutory Reports for creating above-mentioned objects. 

Step 2: Define a Schema 

During setting up the document section in report definition, you must specify a schema or ABAP structure to define the document layout. Use the following sample JSON structure to facilitate file uploads: 

{ 

    "title": "India GSTR Reporting", 

    "type": "object", 

    "properties": { 

        "CompanyCode": { 

            "type": "string", 

            "pattern": "^[0-9]{4}$", 

            "description": "4-digit company code" 

        }, 

        "Country": { 

            "type": "string", 

            "pattern": "^[a-zA-Z]{2}$", 

            "description": "2-letter ISO country code (e.g., IN or In)" 

        } 

    } 

}

Save this schema as a .json file and upload it during report definition configuration. 

Note: The same schema can be used across multiple GST reports. 

Step 3: Configure Document Mapping 

Assign static (literal) values for required fields to simplify the upload process, such as: 

  • Company Code: 1810 
  • Country: IN 

 

 

  

Part 2: Storing Attachments in Document and Reporting Compliance 

Step 1: Generate a Report Run 

Create a new reporting run for the relevant period. This serves as a placeholder for document storage. 

Note: This run is intended only to facilitate document storage. Make sure to consider any storage limitations related to the attachment service. 

Disclaimer: It is not a substitute for a legally required or system-generated statutory file. 

Step 2: Navigate to the Run 

Locate your custom report and the run you created in the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance application. 

 

 

Step 3: Access the Attachments Tab 

Switch to the Attachments tab within the selected run. 

 

 

Step 4: Upload Your Historical File 

Click on Upload and select the desired historical file from your computer

 

 

Step 5: Save the Attachment 

Click Save Attachment to securely store the file in the system for future reference. 

 

 

Conclusion 

By utilizing custom report definitions and the Attachments feature, organizations can centralize access to both new and historical statutory filing records within SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. This method ensures a consistent and auditable compliance process, regardless of your adoption timeline or transitions between reporting solutions.

entry.title: Re: How do I extract text information from sales order he...

As rightly pointed out by @Suryaprakash13  SAP does not provide a released CDS view that directly exposes sales order header texts like internal notes. However, you can use the text retrieval CDS view:

I_SalesOrderTextTP - This CDS view is part of the Sales Order Business Object. It provides access to text data related to sales orders. You can join this with I_SalesOrderTP or I_SalesOrder to enrich your CDS view with header-level text.

entry.title: Benefit Insurance Plan Enrolment Process
entry.content:
Introduction -

Benefit Enrolment Process is the initial step which allows employees to claim/ become a member of a plan.

This is the usual process in most of the firms where employee enrolls for a benefit to be able to eligible to claim.

This article helps us understand the step-by-step processes that are involved/ to be followed while enrolling for a Benefit Insurance Plan.

The below are to be followed to get the Benefit Enrolled.

  

Step1: Login as a user and navigate to Benefits Overview tab and click on it and select Go to Benefits

 

Step2: You will see the Enroll Now option under available benefits, (Since the enrollment type in not Automatic)

 

 Step3: Choose Enrollee Option and Coverage Options from the available options and click on Save

 

Step4: As soon as the enrollee and coverage options are given, Contributions will be auto populate based on the rule(Insurance Contributions Rate Rule) configured

 

 Step5: Once the enrollment process is complete, Benefit Enrollment details will be seen under Insurances section

 

Step6: Navigate to Benefits Overview on the Profile page and check deduction details overview as below

 

Step7: Click on View Benefits Compensation Statement to see the details of deductions (Contributions)

 

Step8: Navigate to Manage Data and Search for Benefit Enrollment record of the employee

(Tip. Search with employee id)

 

Step9: Navigate to Manage Data and search for Recurring Information for Benefit Integration and search for the respective employee deduction details.

(Tip. Search with employee id to find the appropriate record)

 

Step10: Navigate to Manage Data and search for Recurring Deduction and search for the respective employee deduction details.

(Tip. Search with employee id to find the appropriate record)

 

 

Conclusion: Benefit Payroll integration will enable to see the deductions/contributions details which will flow to payroll system and contributions/deductions would be processes accordingly

 

To configure Benefit – Insurance Plan please refer my previous blog Benefit Insurance Configuration

 

Summary:  Insurance Plans with multiple coverage options with multiple Insurance Providers can be created with various rate charts which will optimize the enrolment process for an employee/admins

 

Conclusion: Benefit Payroll Integration will enable to see the deductions/contributions details which will flow to payroll system and contributions/deductions would be processes accordingly.

entry.title: Accessing Employee Information on Inactive Employee Profiles before Start Date
entry.content:
This blog outlines the configuration steps required to access the inactive employee's profile data after onboarding is completed but before the start date.

Scenario: There is a requirement to see the Payment Information or other personal data blocks of a candidate's profile before their official start date when the candidate is still inactive in the system after completing the Onboarding process.

 

Steps to follow:

Step 1: Create a permission role with target population as External Onboarding Users.

Step 2: Grant Employee Profile Section-level permissions:

To view the entire profile sections (like Personal Information, Employment details, etc.), follow the below steps:

  • Go the required permissions role with target population as External Onboarding Users.
  • Go to Employee Views section and check/enable all the sections that you want to see on the Inactive Employee's profile. 

This will give the access to the below highlighted sections on the Employee's profile.

 

Step 3: Grant Employee Profile Block-level permissions:

To view the blocks available in the Employee's profile Sections, follow the below permission path.

 

SectionsBlocksPermission Path
Personal InformationBiographical InformationEmployee Data
Personal InformationPayment InformationMiscellaneous Permissions
Personal InformationNational IdEmployee Data
 

Follow the below steps:

  • Go the required permissions role with target population as External Onboarding Users.
  • Go to Employee Data section and provide View or Edit permission as per the requirement.
  • Similarly for Payment Information, Go to Miscellaneous Permissions and provide the View/Edit permission as per the requirement.

 

Conclusion:

By following the above steps, you can grant access to the Employee Profile of the inactive employee before the start date.

entry.title: How Key Users Create Consistent Text Changes with SAPUI5 Flexibility
entry.content:
SAPUI5 flexibility to adapt standard SAP apps

SAPUI5 is SAP’s strategic Web framework for SAP Fiori. SAPUI5 flexibility allows developers, key users and end users to adapt standard apps with simple drag-and-drop tools. It supports a clean core approach by enabling on-stack extensions without requiring any predefined extension points. Discover all the capabilities in SAPUI5 Flexibility - All You Need to Know.


Changing texts of SAP standard apps

One common use case in this context is changing labels of SAP standard apps to match the terminology used by end users. Similarly, a table column might need to show either the ID of a business object, its text, or even both.


New Feature: Consistent text changes across multiple fields

Previously, if a field appeared multiple times (e.g., in the filter bar and a table column), each occurrence had to be changed separately. Now in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and with SAPUI5 1.136 on SAP BTP, text changes are now applied at the model level in annotations. To do this, the key user does not have to make a decision, the change is automatically applied at the 'lowest possible level'.

I need to be more specific about what the mentioned text changes are, for which this logic applies:

  • Changing labels: Key users can change the field labels according to the terminology used by end users:
    Dialog to change a label
  • Changing text arrangements: By setting the text arrangement, key users can show the descriptive text of some business entity only, the text together with the technical ID or just the ID:
    Dialog to change a text arrangement

The new logic allows key users to focus on the business data model rather than the app's implementation details, enhancing efficiency when adapting standard apps. Also, business users can work more productively with the right text helping them to identify the data they need.

Note: This logic works with annotations and is available in apps based on SAP Fiori elements patterns or using building blocks of the Flexible Programming Model. For more details, see the documentation: Renaming a UI Element and Changing the Text Arrangement.


Going forward

The UI5 team plans* to extend this logic to other types of changes, beyond simple text changes. We will share more details in official UI5 channels like the SAPUI5 Road Map, the SAPUI5 What's New, and documentation in What is SAPUI5 Flexibility.

By the way, be sure to follow the latest updates in Key User Adaptation. These new features are designed to streamline your workflow and enhance productivity of your business users:

"What's New" for Key Users

* Legal Disclaimer: This information, or any related document and SAP's strategy and possible future developments, products and or platforms directions and functionality are all subject to change and may be changed by SAP at any time for any reason without notice.

entry.title: Transform Procurement with the SAP Ariba Business AI Accelerator
entry.content:
Gordon Donovan's, Global Vice President Research, Procurement & External Workforce at SAP, recent conversations with the Procurement Leaders, clearly states that we are currently living in a world of "Polycrisis" - a mix of geopolitical, environment and macroeconomics risks, where Procurement is right on the front lines. Instead of just focusing on cost savings, the role of procurement has become one of Risk Management and Strategic Value Creation and AI plays a critical role in making this shift possible.

These conversations emphasis that AI is a not a buzz word but is a critical tool for facing today's reality. The procurement leaders have pointed out the few key areas where AI plays a major role:

  • Enhanced Risk Management and Resilience
  • Strategic Decision-Making and Optimization
  • Automation and Productivity
  • Data-Driven Supplier Management

Ultimately, Donovan's discussions show that AI is not just about efficiency; it's about giving procurement leaders the intelligence and agility they need to thrive in a world full of interconnected risks. The real power of AI lies in its ability to transform procurement into a function that can anticipate and respond to change, rather than simply reacting to it.

We have the McKinsey's 2024-2025 research which supports these conversations.  AI is set to drive and redefine how the procurement operates, arrive at decisions and deliver value in an Organization. Their findings show that organizations where AI has been adopted early, they are seeing:

  • Up to 30% faster sourcing cycles
  • 5–10% reductions in spend
  • Over 20% improvements in contract compliance
  • Significant reduction in manual exception handling

These Research also identifies four important areas where adopting AI can make a major impact:

  1. Spend analysis and bundling strategies
  2. Supplier performance evaluation and ESG monitoring
  3. Automated RFP creation and negotiation
  4. Reducing value leakage across the Source-to-Pay cycle

Source (https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/operations/our-insights/revolutionizing-procurement-leveraging-data-and-ai-for-strategic-advantage

https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/operations/our-insights/where-is-procurement-heading-in-the-next-ten-years

https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/operations/our-insights/procurement-2025-reimagining-the-function-for-success)

SAP Ariba's embedded capabilities align closely with these areas, and it goes beyond when supported by SAP Joule and the Business AI Accelerator Service in Preferred Success.

Where AI Is Already Delivering Value in SAP Ariba

SAP Ariba was already into the AI Journey before generative AI became the focus in the technology world. The Solution was enabling meaningful automation through traditional Machine Learning AI. The functionalities are already live and in use today.

Guided Sourcing

  • Smart Event Creation helps sourcing leads get started faster by recommending event templates based on historical data
  • Supplier Recommendations suggest relevant, qualified suppliers using profile matching and past performance insights

The result: shorter sourcing cycles, better supplier outcomes, and more informed decisions.

Guided Buying

  • Personalized Product Recommendations surface the most relevant items for each user based on behaviors and role
  • Catalog Item Matching offers compliant alternatives when users search for off-catalog or non-preferred items

The result: increased compliance, reduced maverick spend, and a better buying experience overall.

These use cases represent just a portion of what’s possible. SAP’s AI in Procurement site offers a more comprehensive view for teams looking to explore beyond the basics: Visit SAP AI for Procurement

The Business AI Accelerator Service: What it is and why it matters?

The Business AI Accelerator Service in the Preferred Success isn't about introducing the Organizations to the new technology that is available in the solution. It’s a structured service which is designed to help organizations to start their journey with AI along with their SAP Solutions. It helps them to put AI into action by starting with the embedded capabilities and extending more strategic use cases through custom use case ideation.

Why customers use it:

  • To align AI initiatives with business goals
  • To identify use cases with measurable value
  • To understand how to implement AI responsibly
  • To support users through the transition with change enablement

What it includes:

  1. SAP Business AI Essentials

We start with foundational education: What AI is (and isn’t), how it’s already embedded in SAP solutions, and how our Co-Pilot, SAP Joule enhance procurement operations.

  1. Governance and Ethics Enablement

We provide a framework to ensure that AI initiatives are compliant, transparent, and aligned with SAP’s global principles for ethical AI. That includes privacy, fairness, and human oversight.

  1. Change Management Support

Success with AI isn’t just about data—it’s about people. We provide guidance on how to prepare procurement teams for AI-driven workflows and address the common challenges in adoption

  1. Use Case Discovery Workshop

In this session, we work with your team to identify pain points, assess feasibility, and prioritize use cases that deliver near-term ROI. This is a highly interactive, business-first discussion.

Where to Start:

You don’t need to perfectly define the plan to start the AI journey, our Business AI Accelerator service is designed to meet you on wherever you are in the AI Journey. Whether you're just brainstorming potential use cases or you've already got some ideas you want to validate, this service provides the clarity and expert guidance you need to move forward with confidence.

If you already have Preferred Success subscription for SAP Ariba, then starting with the service is easy. Reach out to your Customer Success Manager to learn more and schedule the sessions to help you unlock and start your AI Journey.

If you are not a Preferred Success Customer yet, simply get in touch with your SAP Partner or Account Representative. They can walk you through the available options to join the program and unlock this, and many other, valuable services.

Learn more about SAP Preferred Success and how it helps customers accelerate outcomes and reduce transformation risk

entry.title: How to Prioritize Inventory with ABC Analysis in SAP EWM
entry.content:
Hi SAP SCM Community!

In this blog, I want to provide information about ABC Analysis in EWM and also give an example of its use.

Introduction

ABC Analysis is a technique used in SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) to categorize inventory items based on their importance. This classification helps in optimizing inventory management by focusing on the most critical items:

Category A: High-value items with low turnover rates. These items require more stringent inventory control and monitoring.

Category B: Moderate-value items with moderate turnover rates. These items need balanced control measures.

Category C: Low-value items with high turnover rates. These items require simpler control measures due to their lower impact on overall inventory value.

 

For this we can go to the Transaction Code: /SCWM/ABC

 

We have three main part in the selection screen:

Location & Product Selection – In this part you can select warehouse number (mandatory criteria), party entitled to dispose, product, warehouse product group and also If you want to limit the products that are analyzed to only those products with warehouse tasks, select Exclude Products w/o WTs:

I prefer, restrict your selection with specific selection criteria for better performance.

Confirmed Product Warehouse Task Selection -  In this part we can give specific confirmation date for the warehouse tasks, also warehouse process category, warehouse process type, source storage type, destination storage type and alternative unit of measure. Due to your requirements you can use these filters too:

Analysis Strategy Selection – Firstly we can choose which analysis we want: It can be number of confirmed warehouse tasks or quantity moved:

After that we can set how many categories we want – Normally, businesses use 3 category:

Also, we can increase the number of categories up to 12:

 

First two parts of Analysis strategy selection is about how we can analyse our warehouse data:

After ABC Analysis we can change three product master data indicator:

  • Putaway control indicator
  • Storage section indicator, either on warehouse level or for specific storage types
  • Cycle counting indicator

 

In the last part of the selection screen is if we want to use update this indicators in background we can click this box:

Also, we can use this box for scheduling job for update master data indicators.

 

Example of using ABC Analysis in EWM

Go to /SCWM/ABC and choose warehouse number, products in that warehouse number and confirmation date for warehouse tasks. As an analysis strategy I select the number of confirmed warehouse tasks, three categories and in the percent basis. Also, I want to update master data for the specific criteria:  for products which is in category A, add/update Putaway strategy (PUTW), and based their category add/update cycle counting indicator:

 

After run this selection screen we can see ABC Analysis Result. The screen displays only the products that are actually to be updated. (In this case New PACI and New CC Ind. field values will be added/updated to the master data of these products.) If you want to display all items, choose All <-> With Changes:

After this you can see one more line which is not have any changes in the master data:

 

Before updating the master data let’s look at one of the products data in /SCWM/MAT1:

Based on the availability of the product master data  in /SCWM/MAT1 you can choose Display/Change or Create:

 

In the Warehouse Data tab you can see Cycle Counting Indicator and Putaway Control fields which are empty:

If you want to update master data for the products you can click the button on the below (Save Selected Updates) and choose which updates do you want, in this scenario I choose All Updates:

Then you can go back to /SCWM/MAT1 and check the updates, so now Cycle Counting Indicator and Putaway Control fields have values which we save in the /SCWM/ABC:

Thanks for reading, if this was helpful or if you have any questions, please leave a comment.

#WarehouseManagement #ABCAnalysis #EWM

 

Best Regards,

Eldar Ibrahimov

Senior EWM Consultant
